de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.controller.datageneration.filltype
Class Dates

java.lang.Object
  de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.controller.datageneration.filltype.Generator
      de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.controller.datageneration.filltype.Dates
All Implemented Interfaces:
FillBehaviour, ObservableFillBehaviour, ObservableGenerator, java.lang.Cloneable
public class Dates
extends Generator

This class is responsible for creating dates. The class inherits behaviour from the abstract class Generator. Generating dates is helpful when the tester is faced with the task to generate a file with a time stamp. Let's assume we've to create a file called sales quantity. It has of course an attribute date modified and date created. The class is able to generate to these attributes (facets) dates.

Observable
It is observable like all other fill behaviours. Observable means in this context, whenever an observer registers to or un-registers from this class, the subject itself notifies the UI to register this class in a specific list of generators.

Naming convention
To avoid irritations and conflicts with Java.util.Date this class is slightly different named.

Since:
Apr/20/09
Version:
0.1
Author:
Michael Munz

getValueAt

public final java.lang.String getValueAt(int n)
Description copied from interface: FillBehaviour
this method has the job of retrieving the value at the specified index. Most fill behaviour strategies are based on value files. These files have a specific amount of possible values from i = 1, ..., n where i is the index. When the process of generating test data is activated, to each facet values of the fill behaviour are used. To get values in the range of the value file, this method is needed. By the way, only the strategies itselves have access to value files.

Specified by:
getValueAt in interface FillBehaviour
Specified by:
getValueAt in class Generator
Parameters:
n - the index specifies the value at position n to retrieve.
Returns:
the value at position n or null

registerObserverGenerator

public void registerObserverGenerator(ObserverGenerator observer)
Description copied from interface: ObservableGenerator
When an observer registers, it's just added to the end of the observer list.

Parameters:
observer - an object to notify when a change occurs.

removeObserverGenerator

public void removeObserverGenerator(ObserverGenerator observer)
Description copied from interface: ObservableGenerator
Likewise, when an observer wants to un-register we just take it off the list.

Parameters:
observer - an object which doesn't want any notifications anymore.

notifyObserverGenerator

public void notifyObserverGenerator(boolean add)
Description copied from interface: ObservableGenerator
Here's the fun part; this is where we tell all observers about the state. Because they are all Observers, we know how to notify them.

This observable is different from common usage, we notify about operations to use, rather updating data structure.

Parameters:
add - here is the operation. There is one of two operations possible.
  • add
    • This operation is explicit, if the flag is set to true. This registers the observable to a list holding available generators.
  • remove
    • This operation is implicit, if the flag is set to false. This is the vice versa function. It removes the subject from the list of available generators.
